Hi , 
I have a general question , and it is more of a design issue.

Currently , i am involved in a java project that has 3 people working on.
We have somthing around 2000 junit tests running on a nightly build basis ,using ANT.
The nightly build proccess ends with a mail report that has the summery of the tests
reports , and has a link to a directory , where all tests reports are bundled.
I mean , in the mail there is something like :
1900 tests succeed , 100 tests failed ..

I also have a small util that can scan these reports and look for a specific string ,
like "Page Fault occured" , and add a reference to specific test report and line number.
That way each developer of the 3 , can look at the mail summery , and search if there is
any problem related to his part of the project.the summery is not too long or complicated
to look in .

This strategy works fine in this quantity of tests and developers.
What happens if I want to expand these nightly build tests 10 times more.
Now , the project involves 30 developers , divided into sub teams.
If i use the currnt format of reporting , i will get very big logs of ,2000*10 =
20000,tests .And big mail summery that contain information that does not interest every
one.
rpoblem 1:
James , is in sub team A , and he wrote com.company.pkg.testConcernsToJamesOnly
and Rachel , is from team B , and she wrote com.company.pkg.testRachelTests
James don't want to see Rachels tests reports or mail summery , he don't want to get lost
in a big amount of data when he looks for his results.
is there a way to split outputs , according to packages ?
i.e, James's tests result will be sent to a differnt log file.

problem 2:
In a week , Rachel is going to be fired ( don't tell her that...)
I want all reports and mail summery that rachel got , will be sent to her successor.
is there a way to create a connection between users and tests packages?
i.e , now com.company.pkg.testRachelTests belong to George (the new guy replacing Rachel)
, 
and for James too, for two weeks only, 
and com.company.pkg.testConcernsToJamesOnly still belongs to James

I thought of maybe a configuration file that has notification list :
_________________________________________
James 
com.company.pkg.testConcernsToJamesOnly 
com.company.pkg.testRachelTests 

George 
com.company.pkg.testRachelTests 
_________________________________________

but how do i implement this .
does JUNIT / ANT support stuff like that?
this is a real life issue
regards 
Yair
